name: PromotionCriteriaGroup
comment: This entity includes the different criteria groups based on which a promotion is qualified or given to the end customer.
vf short description: This entity includes the different criteria groups based on which a promotion is qualified or given to the end customer.

fields.name: PromotionCriteriaGroupSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: PromotionCriteriaGroupKey
fields.comment: Uniquely identifies a Promotion Criteria Group. Generated Key based on Promotion Key and Promotion Criteria Group Id

fields.name: ParentPromotionCriteriaGroupSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PromotionSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PromotionCriteriaGroupId
fields.comment: The ID of the criteria group Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.id

fields.name: PromotionCriteriaGroupName
fields.comment: The name of the criteria group. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.groupName

fields.name: PromotionCriteriaGroupType
fields.comment: The type of the criteria. Usually, represents a context entity such as Customer, Product Offering, Product, and so on. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.criteriaType

fields.name: CriteriaGroupTypeMethod
fields.comment: The criteria type method used to describe the criteria group type. The supported criteria group types are - Scope, Criteria, List, Aggregation, and so on. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.criteriaTypeMethod

fields.name: RelationTypeInGroupInd
fields.comment: The logical relation type amongst the various criteria inside the promotion criteria group. The AND and the OR logical relations are supported. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.relationTypeInGroup

fields.name: ScopeCommonParameterInd
fields.comment: Relevant for criteria groups with criteriaTypeMethod = Scope. Represents a common parameter that must be qualified on all criteria groups defined uder the scope. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.equalVariable

fields.name: AggregateCriteriaId
fields.comment: The id of the aggregate function criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.aggregationFunctionCriteria.id

fields.name: AggregateCriteriaParameterName
fields.comment: The parameter of the aggregate function criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.aggregationFunctionCriteria.criteriaParam

fields.name: AggregateCriteriaParameterDetail
fields.comment: The parameter detail of the aggregate function criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.aggregationFunctionCriteria.criteriaParamName

fields.name: AggregateCriteriaCondition
fields.comment: The operator of the aggregate function criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.aggregationFunctionCriteria.criteriaOperator

fields.name: AggregateCriteriaValue
fields.comment: The value of the aggregate function criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.aggregationFunctionCriteria.criteriaValue

fields.name: AggregateCriteriaUomInd
fields.comment: The UOM of the aggregate function criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.aggregationFunctionCriteria.criteriaUOM

fields.name: ScopeId
fields.comment: The id of the scope. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.id

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaType
fields.comment: The type of the scope criteria. Usually, represents a context entity such as Customer, Product Offering, Product, and so on. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteriaType

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaTypeMethod
fields.comment: The scope criteria type method used to describe the criteria group type. The supported criteria group types are - Scope, Criteria, List, Aggregation, and so on. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteriaTypeMethod

fields.name: ScopeRelationTypeInGroupInd
fields.comment: The logical relation type amongst the various criteria inside the scope criteria group. The AND and the OR logical relations are supported. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.relationTypeInGroup

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaId
fields.comment: The id of the scope criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteria.id

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaParameterName
fields.comment: The parameter of the scope criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteria.criteriaParam

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaParameterDetail
fields.comment: The parameter detail of the scope criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteria.criteriaParamName

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaCondition
fields.comment: The operator of the scope criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteria.criteriaOperator

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaValue
fields.comment: The value of the scope criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteria.criteriaValue

fields.name: ScopeCriteriaUomInd
fields.comment: The UOM of the scope criteria. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.scopeCriteria.criteria.criteriaUOM

fields.name: RestrictionBenefitLimitCount
fields.comment: The benefit limit of the count restriction. Specifies how many of the counted items can be included within a promotion instance as benefits. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.countRestriction.benefitLimit

fields.name: RestrictionForPaymentCount
fields.comment: The paid item limit of the count restriction. Specifies out of the counted items within a promotion instance how many should be paid for. Promotion.pattern.criteriaGroup.countRestriction.payForCount

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
